From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure the amount of time after which a process should voluntarily yield to another process, use the **process-max-time** command in global configuration mode. To reset this value to the system default, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Maximum duration (in milliseconds) that a process can run before suspension. The range is from 20to 200 milliseconds.

Examples: The following example limits the duration that a process will run to 100 <milliseconds>:
ExtraInfo: Lowering the maximum time a process can run is useful in some circumstances to ensure equitable division of CPU time among different tasks.Only use this command if recommended to do so by the Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC).
